file_insights.summary: Added mode property to renderNodes call to enable mode-aware rendering downstream

Added mode-aware rendering with conditional UI: Basic mode shows simplified node list with only paired/offline status; Advanced mode shows full features including Exec approvals, bindings, and all node capabilities/commands

patterns_discovered: Conditional rendering based on AppMode enum ('basic' vs 'advanced')
Prop drilling mode through component hierarchy
Template conditional rendering using hyperscript tagged template literals with ternary expressions
Simplified UI presentation for basic mode - reduced chip row to essential info only
gotchas_discovered: Required importing AppMode type from navigation.ts to properly type the mode prop
Had to pass isBasic flag to child renderNode function since it operates in isolation within a .map() callback
Basic mode hides Exec approvals and bindings sections entirely rather than showing simplified versions
discoveries.approach_outcome: SUCCESS - Implemented mode-aware rendering where Basic mode provides simplified view with only Nodes and Devices sections, while Advanced mode includes full feature set (Exec approvals, bindings, and detailed node capabilities)
recommendations: Consider extracting mode-checking logic into a reusable hook or utility function to avoid repetition across views
Document the mode-aware rendering pattern for consistency when implementing other views
Consider adding mode-specific styling or layout variations beyond just content filtering
Test both modes thoroughly to ensure all interactive features work correctly in Advanced mode
